answers.answer: Hi,This does not seem to be a serious problem as your brain scans are clear. I would suggest you to take B complex supplements as the symptoms could be due to peripheral neuropathy. If you have a positive family history of diabetes, you can get your blood sugar levels checked because diabetes can also cause neuropathy.Hope this helps!

question: I have had a tingling (vibrationr) sensation in my head (jaw, teeth, nose, temples, ears) since I had an MRI on December 23.  I have had a CT scan and MRI on my brain since, that have both come back normal.  I seem to have the tingling sensation most often when I'm around the dryer, stereo, computer, in the car, etc.  My doctor has given me a steroid for possible inflamation, but that didn't work.  Do you have any suggestions for what I should do next?
title: Tingling sensation in head
